On 1/20/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> I'm a little confused by t=
he TestNG description above. Are you saying
> that you saved memory by lazi=
ly classloading? Loading lots of classes
> can be a memory drain--all Java =
programs have this issue--but I had
> assumed that the goal was reducing th=
e amount of data, not classes, in

Sorry for the confusion.  I w=
as talking about object instances all along.

And this problem can be compo=
unded in TestNG by @Test(invocationCount =3D
1000), which creates 1000 inst=
ances of that test (one for each invocation).
